line_1: Make some chaste Wives to merit a Divorce.
line_2: Of some pure Virgins; or what's almost worse,

line_1: Nothing can save him but divorce,
line_2: And here the wife complys of course.

line_1: Their linkt Affections Fate cou'd not divorce,
line_2: Nor Rig'rous Death restrain their Entercourse:
What Crimes can I have wrought t'enforce

line_1: And when the Parties clash, makes a Divorce.
line_2: But friendly Death absolves us from this Curse,
And both pursue their separate course.

line_1: Parting had then been no Divorce.
line_2: I cou'd have done't without Remorse,

line_1: This riving stroke, this ultimate divorce,
line_2: Nature opposes with her utmost force,
